clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Assessment of the Anatomic Landmarks for Spinal Anesthesia in Patients With Hip Fracture
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Assessment of the Anatomic Landmarks for Spinal Anesthesia in Patients With Hip Fracture

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators assess the anatomic landmarks for spinal anesthesia in patients with hip fracture using ultrasonography.

detailed_description.textblock: Investigators evaluate the anatomic landmarks using Tuffier's line and the tenth rib line for spinal anesthesia in patients with hip fracture, and then assess the consistency of the landmarks-guided interspinous levels with the actual interspinous level using ultrasonography.

study_design_info.masking_description: An investigator evaluate the interspinous level using anatomic landmarks, then other independent investigator assess the consistency of the landmarks-guided interspinous level with the actual one using ultrasonography. Participants are blinded to the assessment results.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of each anatomic landmark (Tuffier's line and tenth rib line).
primary_outcome.description: Actual interspinous levels of the landmark-guided approches (Tuffier's line and tenth rib line) are assessed using ultrasonography.

secondary_outcome.measure: The estimation ratio related to the intervertebral levels
secondary_outcome.description: Actual interspinous levels of the landmark-guided approches (Tuffier's line and tenth rib line) are assessed using ultrasonography.

arm_group.description: In the lateral decubitus position, an investigator evaluate the L4-5 interspinous level using an anatomic landmark (Tuffier's line), and then evaluate the L4-5 interspinous level using another anatomic landmark (Tenth rib line). Another investigator evaluate the actual L4-5 interspinous level by noninvasive ultrasonography.

In the lateral decubitus position, an investigator evaluate the L4-5 interspinous level using an anatomic landmark (Tenth rib line), and then evaluate the L4-5 interspinous level using another anatomic landmark (Tuffier's line). Another investigator evaluate the actual L4-5 interspinous level by noninvasive ultrasonography.

intervention.description: An investigator evaluate the L4-5 interspinous level using anatomic landmarks in turn, then another independent investigator assess the consistency of the landmarks-guided interspinous level with the actual one by noninvasive ultrasound assessment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled for hip fracture surgery under spinal anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anatomic abnormalities or masses in the spine
- History of spinal surgery of compression fracture
